intro: Ectrosiopsis lasioclada, commonly known as the rough-hairy flax, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its hairy, glandular leaves and yellow ray florets. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments. It produces small, daisy-like flowers that attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Its unique morphology and ecological adaptations make it an interesting subject for botanical study.
